alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Leslie; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 4:10AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Clay, Knox, Leslie and Perry. * WHEN...Until 715 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vicco, Hoskinston, Stinnett, Asher, Wendover, Essie, Cinda, Causey, Smilax, Cutshin, Big Fork, Roark, Daley, Yeaddiss, Queendale, Spring Creek, Big Rock, Creekville, Skidmore and Ashers Fork. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
